citeinfo.title: NJ TRANSIT, PATH and PATCO Passenger Rail Station points, 2016 (NAD83, NJSP feet)
citeinfo.edition: No change to data definition from release of 2015-07. Data records have been updated.

pubinfo.publish: NJ Office of Information Technology (NJOIT), Office of Geographic Information Systems (OGIS)

citeinfo.othercit: Zip file also includes service right-of-way line data.

descript.abstract: Point data delineating station point locations for rail, light rail, and subway service lines operated by NJ TRANSIT and connecting commuter lines operated by Port Authority Trans Hudson (PATH) and Port Authority Transit Corporation (PATCO). Points for most stations are located as delivered by NJT GIS, with a few exceptions. Some of the attributes have been updated. See process steps for details.
descript.purpose: Provides station location and attribute information for currently operated regional rail service. Data set is intended only for general planning and mapping use. Station points do not necessarily fall on rail line segments.
descript.supplinf: Most of the station points were heads-up digitized from New Jersey 2007 High Resolution Orthophotography or from New Jersey 2012 High Resolution Orthophotography, both of which have a 1 foot pixel size and tested accuracy of +/- 4 feet. Some of the station locations were derived from other sources. Data set is published in shapefile format (Esri). This shapefile does not include linear referencing m values, and the stations are not topologically connected to the rail lines. These data are re-published by NJ Office of Information Technology (NJOIT), Office of Geographic Information Systems (OGIS) under agreement with NJ TRANSIT - GIS-Transportation.

idinfo.useconst: See conditions and disclaimers on NJ TRANSIT developer Web site. See Purpose, Data Quality, and Distribution sections in this metadata record for conditions that limit appropriate uses. Acknowledgement of the data set providers, NJ TRANSIT, GIS-Transportation and NJ Office of Information Technology (NJOIT), Office of Geographic Information Systems (OGIS), would be appreciated for maps, data or other products derived from this data set.
idinfo.datacred: Source data in shapefile format are provided by Glenn D. Newman PLS, PP, Director of GIS-Transportation at NJ TRANSIT. Attribute data format cleanup by Steven Karp, Office for Planning Advocacy, NJ Department of State.
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; Esri ArcGIS 10.3.1.4959

attracc.attraccr: Station names were edited by Steven Karp and checked by inspection.

dataqual.logic: The station points are not topologically connected to rail line data. They vary in accuracy and in location relative to tracks, platforms, and station buildings.
dataqual.complete: Includes only stations currently used by passenger rail service. Includes stations for non-NJ TRANSIT commuter rail service that connects with NJ TRANSIT service in terms of proximity, i.e. PATCO Speedline, and PANYNJ PATH service. Does include NJ TRANSIT Wesmont station, under construction.

horizpa.horizpar: Rail station location data for most of the lines were digitized from New Jersey 2007 HIgh Resolution Orthophotography, which has a tested accuracy of +/- 4 feet, NSSDA, and a one foot pixel size. Source of station data for subsurface lines (e.g. PATH, PATCO, Newark Light Rail) was not provided to metadata author. Some station locations for PATCO were edited using New Jersey 2012 High Resolution Orthoimagery and New Jersey 2015 High Resolution Orthoimagery, which met at least same accuracy standards as 2007 data.

citeinfo.origin: NJ Office of Information Technology (NJOIT), Office of Geographic Information Systems (OGIS)
citeinfo.title: NJ TRANSIT, PATH and PATCO Passenger Rail Station points, 2015 (NAD83, NJSP feet)

srcinfo.srccontr: Shapefiles were provided of NJT Rail, NJT Light Rail, PATH, and PATCO stations, with station names and locations, and several other attributes.

citeinfo.origin: NJ Office of Information Technology (NJOIT), Office of Geographic Information Systems (OGIS)
citeinfo.title: New Jersey 2015 High Resolution Orthophotography, Natural Color Web Map Service (WMS)

srcinfo.srccontr: Statewide orthophotography flown in March - May 2015.

procstep.procdesc: Shapefiles sent by NJ TRANSIT were compiled into a single file geodatabase feature class. Locations of some PATCO stations were edited, based on 2012 orthophotography, personal knowledge, and other publicly-accessible information. Attribute ATIS_ID was filled in from previous station layer, partly by joining on station name and partly by manual examination of station name and rail line. Entries were cross checked afterward using those fields. Station names were converted to title case and manually edited to make punctutation and abbreviation consistent. Most now match the previous version of the data, with station names edited by Steven Karp.

RAIL_LINE entry was edited to match case and punctuation as on NJ TRANSIT Web Site, PATH and PATCO Web Sites. MUN_LABEL field was also filled in from previous entries by Karp. Latitude and Longitude were calculated for station locations per NAD83. AMTRAK attribute was added and filled in based on AMTRAK Web page list and map of Northeast AMTRAK stations, from previous station layer.

January release of NJ TRANSIT data was compared to previously-published OGIS data by doing a select by location using a 500 ft intersect buffer. Records from the previous OGIS data were used for most stations. Wesmont station was added to OGIS data. The point for Bay Head station was moved to match NJ TRANSIT mapped location in their release of 2016-01-09. The point for the Princeton (University) station was moved to the new track centerline, in front of the newly-constructed station location, as shown on 2015 orthophotography.

cntorgp.cntorg: NJ Office of Information Technology (NJOIT), Office of Geographic Information Systems (OGIS)

mapproj.mapprojn: NAD 1983 StatePlane New Jersey FIPS 2900 Feet

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Latitude of the location in decimal degrees

attrdomv.udom: Real numbers, decimal degrees per NAD83

attr.attrdef: Longitude of the location in signed decimal degrees

attrdomv.udom: Real numbers, decimal degrees per NAD83

attr.attrdef: Name of rail line used for named passenger service, on which the station is a stop. Roughly equivalent to RAIL_LINE attribute in Tran_railroad_passenger. However, cannot be used to join in current format. See following notes: For stations shared by more than one line, the lines are all included in the same entry, as abbreviations. Entries not well controlled; in some cases, names or abbreviations differ that refer to the same line.

edom.edomvd: Station on Atlantic City Line
Station on Gladstone Branch (only) of Morris & Essex line
Station on Hudson-Bergen Light Rail Line
Station on Main/Bergen Line. Some stations access both services, some only one or the other
Station on Meadowlands Rail Line
Station on Montclair-Boonton Line
Station on Morris & Essex Line
Station on Morristown Line/Morris & Essex Line
Station on Northeast Corridor Line and North Jersey Coast Line
Station on Northeast Corridor Line, North Jersey Coast Line, and Morris & Essex Line.
Station on Northeast Corridor Line, North Jersey Coast Line, Morris & Essex Line, Main Line, and Bergen County Line
Station on Northeast Corridor Line, North Jersey Coast Line, and Raritan Valley Line
Station on Newark Light Rail/subway
Station on North Jersey Coast Line
Station on Northeast Corridor Line
Station on Pascack Valley Line
Station on PATCO line; Delaware River Port Authority
Station on Port Authority Trans Hudson Line; Port Authority of NY & NJ
Station on Port Jervis Line (only)
Station on Raritan Valley Line (only)
Station on River LINE

attrdomv.udom: Text string of station name with abbreviations and proper case

attr.attrdef: Name of municipality in which the station is located
attr.attrdefs: NJ Department of State, Office for Planning Advocacy

codesetd.codesetn: Municipalities of New Jersey, New Jersey State Plane NAD83, boundary feature class

attr.attrdef: Name of county in which the station is located

attrdomv.udom: County names in all capital letters

attr.attrdef: Unique identifier for the station record

attrdomv.udom: Text string of unique ID. Format varies by type of rail (NJT, NJT light rail, PATH, PATCO)

edom.edomvd: Yes, station accesses AMTRAK trains
No, station does not access AMTRAK trains

distinfo.distliab:
See conditions and disclaimers on NJ TRANSIT developer Web site.
The State of New Jersey makes great effort to provide secure, accurate, and complete data and metadata. However, portions of the data and metadata may be incorrect or not current. Any errors or omissions should be reported for investigation.
The State of New Jersey, its officers, employees or agents shall not be liable for damages or losses of any kind arising out of or in connection with the use or performance of data and metadata, including but not limited to, damages or losses caused by reliance upon the accuracy or timeliness of any such data and metadata, or damages incurred from the viewing, distributing, or copying of those materials.
The data and metadata are provided "as is." No warranty of any kind, implied, expressed, or statutory, including but not limited to the warranties of non-infringement of third party rights, title, merchantability, fitness for a particular purpose, and freedom from computer virus, is given with respect to the data and metadata, or its hyperlinks to other Internet resources.
The State disclaims any duty or obligation either to maintain availability of or to update the data and metadata.

stdorder.ordering:
In order to access GTFS data, you must sign up for an account on the NJ TRANSIT site for developers at https://www.njtransit.com/mt/mt_servlet.srv?hdnPageAction=MTDevLoginTo
After login the page provides access to downloads of zipped GTFS data for rail and bus, including schedule information; instructions for the DepartureVision Web Service; RSS Feeds of Travel Advisories for Rail, Bus, Light Rail; and RSS Feed of Customer Notices for All Modes.
